Requirements.Description: Communication is the process of gathering, organizing and conveying information and ideas. Our students will learn how to communicate through various means and grow in their ability to be coherent, concise and persuasive.
Data Analysis focuses on how to make statistical decisions and inferences from data. Students will learn how to collect, analyze and ethically communicate findings to a general audience.
Computational Thinking focuses on problem-solving using information technologies and computation, including hands-on experience with computer programs and consideration of their societal impact.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3

Requirements.Description: Contextual Thinking is the ability to explore the circumstances and history surrounding an issue or event, understanding why and how problems persist and what solutions have been attempted.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3

Requirements.Description: Intercultural and Global Inquiry develops cultural awareness and the ability to interpret the world through both personal and external perspectives.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3

Requirements.Description: Scientific Inquiry involves critically evaluating the scientific process—from hypothesis generation through experimental design to data analysis—and understanding its societal impact and limitations.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3

Requirements.Description: The Humanities introduce students to human culture and society via analytic and critical methods, expanding their ability to examine problems socially, politically, and morally.
The Social Sciences explore causes and consequences of behavior through analytical and mathematical models, helping students understand individual and societal phenomena.
Logic/Mathematical Reasoning develops the ability to form arguments supported by evidence and respond to counterclaims meaningfully.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed anytime during undergraduate career

Requirements.Description: The Arts build interpretive and perceptual skills, preparing students to understand and share culture and to enrich their lives through artistic expression.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed anytime during undergraduate career

Requirements.Description: Students choose one course in Business, Design, or Engineering to explore tools for solving complex problems within those fields.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed anytime during undergraduate career

Requirements.Description: First-year students take a seminar on real, complex global problems (e.g., sustainability, equity) taught by multidisciplinary faculty teams.
Courses examine inequalities that lead to or result from injustice, exploring which inequalities we are ethically obligated to combat and how to do so.
Requirements.Timeline: Can be completed in Year 1, 2, or 3

Requirements.Description: Apply classroom learning in real-world settings (e.g., internships, research, study abroad, community engagement) with reflection built in.
Requirements.Timeline: Beginning with the class of 2028, each student must complete and reflect on at least one activity
